subject: Home & DIY
title: Greywater Systems Reuse Your Shower Water
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Greywater Systems Reuse Your Shower Water.

hook.text: Your shower, sink, and washer water is clean enough to flush toilets and water gardensâ€”but most homes send it to sewers.

buildup.text: Greywater excludes toilet and kitchen waste. It makes up 50-80% of a household's total wastewater volume.

discovery.text: Simple gravity systems divert greywater to garden irrigation. Advanced ones filter and pump it to toilet cisterns.

twist.text: Most codes still treat greywater as sewage. Even in drought zones, legal reuse demands permits and inspections.

climax.text: Australia leads in residential greywater adoptionâ€”systems are standard in new builds across drought-affected regions.

punchline.text: Your shower water flushes your toilet. Twice the value, same drop.
